abstract.simpara: Though Scarab end-users are more likely to use Ant to build Scarab, as a developer you will need Maven to access all development functionalities, among which documentation generation.

sect1.title: Maven 1
sect1.simpara: Though Maven 2 is getting momentum and has officially become the mainstream version at the end of 2005, Scarab still uses Maven 1.
Maven 1 and Maven 2 are functionnally equivalent but they are not syntactically compatible and use different build files.
sect1.para: So you will need to install Maven 1 and refer to the Maven 1 documentation at this URL: http://maven.apache.org/maven-1.x/
